actions.title: First prompt
actions.description: Run prompt with the description AND evaluate the model AND get score

actions.title: Run classes prompt
actions.prePrompt: Incorrect classes: There are some problems with the classes in the model.
prompts: - The following classes are missing: <List of classes separated by comma>
- The following classes should not be part of the model: <List of classes separated by comma>
- <Class 1> should [not] be abstract.
actions.fewShot: An example of a class is....

actions.title: Run classes prompt
actions.prePrompt: Incorrect classes: There are some problems with the classes in the model.
prompts: - The following classes are missing: <List of classes separated by comma>
- The following classes should not be part of the model: <List of classes separated by comma>
- <Class 1> should [not] be abstract.
actions.fewShot: An example of a class is....

actions.title: Run attributes prompt
actions.prePrompt: Incorrect attributes: There are some problems with the attributes in the model:
prompts: - Class <class name> is missing attribute/s: <list of attribute names>
- Class <class name> has the following extra attribute/s: <list of attribute names>

actions.title: Run associations prompt
actions.prePrompt: Incorrect associations: There are some problems with the associations in the model:
prompts: - The association between classes <class 1, class 2> is missing.
- There is an association between classes <class 1, class 2> that should not exist.
- The association type between classes <class 1> and <class 2> is wrong. It should be a composition association.
- The association type between classes <class 1> and <class 2> is wrong. It should be a aggregation association.
- The association type between classes <class 1> and <class 2> is wrong. It should be a standard association.

actions.title: Run assoc mult prompt
actions.prePrompt: Incorrect associations multiplicities: There are some problems with the associations multiplicities in the model:
prompts: - The association between classes <class 1, class 2> (with the name of <associationName>) should expect <cardinality_class 1> <class 1> to be related with <cardinality_class2> <class 2>.
- The association between classes <class 1, class 2> (with the name of <associationName>) have the multiplicities of each entity in the reverse side.

actions.title: Run assoc mult prompt
actions.prePrompt: Incorrect associations multiplicities: There are some problems with the associations multiplicities in the model:
prompts: - The association between classes <class 1, class 2> (with the name of <associationName>) should expect <cardinality_class 1> <class 1> to be related with <cardinality_class2> <class 2>.
- The association between classes <class 1, class 2> (with the name of <associationName>) have the multiplicities of each entity in the reverse side.
